channel.title: Help with client crash
channel.description:
Hey guys. A Little new here but Need some help. I have downloaded about 3-4 client/sources and all the clients have crashed. I don't think there is anything wrong with the Java path as the server is working fine. Here are some screenshots that may help you diagnose the problem.
[img]http://i58.tinypic.com/20a9jpu.png[/img]
There is the client compiler. There seems to be a few warnings in there. I don't know if that is what is contributing to the problem as I am very new to the server coding area. I am starting a test server so I can learn the basics.
[img]http://i60.tinypic.com/2j64wly.png[/img]
That's what I get when I run the client.
I hope this can be sorted out. I can print screen any code you need to look at etc.

item.title: Help with client crash
item.dc:creator: @hellspawn867 hellspawn867
item.description:
@hellspawn867 wrote:

I tried both of these and neither worked.

I have team viewer if anyone would like to take a look…

Read full topic

item.title: Help with client crash
item.dc:creator: @codyorr4 codyorr4
item.description:
@codyorr4 wrote:

screenshot of the

loader.java

whats your ip set to in loader.java, port also.

if your trying to run in localhost put it to 127.0.0.1 port 43594

if that fails, you probably have the wrong client and should use foxtrots client
just google it.

could be your cache too but then again you wouldn’t have been able to run the server.

but justincase i guess, make sure its in the data folder. SERVER\data\cache

Read full topic

also client compiler warning are normal.
theyre just warnings.

unless you wana tell me the revision for me to tell you how to fix.

add me on skype codyzorrz
